AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! I never usually leave reviews, but I had to because of this horrible experience.  Yesterday my wife and I used this company to assist with our apartment swap with a woman that lives down the street. She also used this company for the swap.  The workers themselves were very professional and we had absolutely no issues with them. It was management that was the biggest let down.  We purchased a 2 hr minimum package which seems like a good deal at the start, but believe me it isn't.  In the lead up to the swap, we called several times and spoke to Mikael who seemed all over the place, forgetting that we were even booked with flyttfixarna.  An employee of the company came to our home to inspect for the cleaning and told us it would take 1 hour to empty.  We know that it would take us a lot longer than that to empty it, but since she said so, we assumed they had their way of doing it.  So with this information we would assume the whole move would take 2, maximum 3 hours. This was a big reason we decided to go with this company rather than the fixed priced alternative companies.  On the day we took a walk with our 2 month old baby because naturally we assumed what we had been told to be true, and we planned to come back after an hour and direct where boxes should go etc...  So we came back and not only were they not finished, but they told us it would take 5 hours! 5 hours! We went to the other apartment, and they told us 3. The other apartment was larger, we couldn't see the logic in this.  It's not the fact that it took a long time that upset us, it is that we were told false information. We ended up paying double what we had planned.  To make matters worse, after the move I requested to speak to Mikael again to discuss this, so they put me on with their boss Sam. I tried explaining that the reason we were upset was because of the information we had been told, but i couldn't get a word in because he kept yelling at me.  After this phone call, I payed for the move. Very hurt and belittled by an aggressive man on the phone. After I payed,  he called my wife and threatened her. NEVER USE THESE GUYS. |0

Stay far away from Badrumsrenoverarna! Initially the communication went reasonably smooth. Had contact with one of their employees on a regular basis and had a pleasurable experience when he came by for the offert. After the offert was written things started going downhill from there. A date was agreed to start the work and during the work there was some contact with our contact person. After the initial work was completed, communication started to get slower and slower and it became harder to get in touch with them.  During the renovation, one of their employees managed to go through our kitchen wall and we were promised that it would be fixed. We had to actively chase Badrumsrenoverarna on numerous occasions for them to come by and fix the wall.  Invoicing: Now the fun part, the invoice was going to be split in two. One part to be paid up front, the other part to be paid after the delivery of the bathroom and all the work and documents were completed.  There were several issues with the bathroom that needed to be resolved and we made it clear that the second invoice would not be paid until then. 1) The tap for the sink was leaking. It took 4 visits before it was resolved and the last time the guy was done in 3 minutes and stated that something was simply screwed in at a little angle and it shouldn't have taken 4 visits to resolve. 2) The guy that set up the tiles on the wall put in a couple of tiles with faults in them. We were promised to have them replaced and eventually after several contacts they were replaced. 3) There were covers missing for where the electrical cables are hidden in the wall. After weeks of asking for them, they were finally "installed". 4) Paperwork was missing for our bathroom. No paperwork was given for the electrical work until we asked for it on several occasions.  As usual in good stories, the best is saved for last. We ordered almost all our stuff at H√∂gan√§s and had the invoice go via Badrumsrenoverarna. The shower doors that we initially ordered turned out not to fit and on the same day, the contractor called us and said we'll take them back, return them and you just order new ones. This can happen and it's not a problem at all!  Now fast forward 8 months when finally after asking on dozens of occasions that invoice for H√∂gan√§s came in. The invoice was unspecified and pretty much just stated "Inredning". We asked several times for a specification and finally informed them formally that without specification, the invoice will not be paid. When we finally received the specification, we noticed that the doors that were supposed to be returned, were still there. We were told that the doors could not be returned and we should pay for them as well. After literally dozens of contact moments since the initial call that the doors didn't fit, we find out that the doors could not be returned. If we were made aware of this at that point in time, we would have found an alternative solution by buying a space of some sorts. Badrumsrenoverarna stated that the doors are still in their warehouse and they can be delivered to us. Funny thing is, if we hadn't asked for the specification, I doubt that we would have known that the doors were in their warehouse to start with.  Overall, stay away! Bad communication and terrible treatment of their customers in all aspects! |0

column1: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! I never usually leave reviews, but I had to because of this horrible experience.  Yesterday my wife and I used this company to assist with our apartment swap with a woman that lives down the street. She also used this company for the swap.  The workers themselves were very professional and we had absolutely no issues with them. It was management that was the biggest let down.  We purchased a 2 hr minimum package which seems like a good deal at the start, but believe me it isn't.  In the lead up to the swap, we called several times and spoke to Mikael who seemed all over the place, forgetting that we were even booked with flyttfixarna.  An employee of the company came to our home to inspect for the cleaning and told us it would take 1 hour to empty.  We know that it would take us a lot longer than that to empty it, but since she said so, we assumed they had their way of doing it.  So with this information we would assume the whole move would take 2, maximum 3 hours. This was a big reason we decided to go with this company rather than the fixed priced alternative companies.  On the day we took a walk with our 2 month old baby because naturally we assumed what we had been told to be true, and we planned to come back after an hour and direct where boxes should go etc...  So we came back and not only were they not finished, but they told us it would take 5 hours! 5 hours! We went to the other apartment, and they told us 3. The other apartment was larger, we couldn't see the logic in this.  It's not the fact that it took a long time that upset us, it is that we were told false information. We ended up paying double what we had planned.  To make matters worse, after the move I requested to speak to Mikael again to discuss this, so they put me on with their boss Sam. In this phone call he yelled at me and patronised me saying "DO YOU KNOW WHO I AM?" etc.... and threatened to report me to the Swedish Authorities.  I tried explaining that the reason we were upset was because of the information we had been told, but i couldn't get a word in because he kept yelling at me.  After this phone call, I payed for the move. Very hurt and belittled by an aggressive man on the phone. After I payed,  he called my wife and threatened her. NEVER USE THESE GUYS. |0

column1: I put my car there the wednesday before last week because of some battery problems, first they said change the battery will be enough, then they said the alternator must be replaced as well, it costs 14 thousand kronor, which is quite expensive, I wanted my car to be fixed so I don't have any other choices. Two days later on friday they called me said they didn't find the special key/adaptor in my car to take off the wheel, I don't understand why they need to take off the wheel for a battery problem, I told them I put the key home(for safety reasons), and I know they have the same key in the workshop because when I did the service check there last year, they used their own key to take off the wheels. I asked them to use their key as before, and they said they would charge me extra money like several hundred for finding the key, otherwise I must go home and fetch my own key, which will take me one hour to do that, but for them, it's just several minutes to find the key. They insisted to charge me money if I want them to find the key and said "time is money", and even I go home and get the key, I can't get my car back that day as planned, because I will delay their work and can only get my car back the next week. It was 11am and they said they will close at 15:30(actually 16:00), I don't understand whey 4 hours is not enough for changing the battery, but I really needed the car so I had to accept the extra charge and got angry. After I got my car, I found that the driver seat is damaged, there‚Äôs an obviously scrape on it and even the thread is broken. Earlier this autumn I had had a very pleasant dinner at your restaurant and therefore returned for dinner with my friend last Friday. Unfortunately
column2: this time around the experience was far from pleasant.  Upon arrival we weren't greeted by the staff. After waiting for quite a while we approached the waitresses (who were gathered near by) asking to be seated. They were resistant but one of them eventually left to find the hostess
column3: who showed up later telling us that she'll need a few minutes to set up our table. We got seated 20 minutes past our original booking time.  Throughout the evening we were served by several waitresses whom none of which were attentive or friendly
column4: and many of them weren't familiar with the menu. Service we received didn't make us feel taken care of and prevented us from enjoying our evening to the fullest.  The food was another major disappointment especially when compared to my former visit. We didn't feel that we received the value for our money. Furthermore
column5: my salmon was served with gravy
column6: which was not specified on the menu. I did not order gravy in the first place and was not notified about this addition at any point during the ordering of the dish.  Currently
column7: I have two completely different experiences from your restaurant
column8: but because of the latest visit I can no longer recommend your restaurant and will sadly not return either.  I hope this criticism will help you to improve the consistency and quality of the service and food you offer. |0

Our experience at Djurg√•rdsbrunn is usually great
column2: so we were really looking forward to our dinner date last Thursday (March 16th). Unfortunately
column3: this experience was not as good as our previous visits. We received a great welcome and were shown to a nice table off to the side by a fish tank. The atmosphere was perfect and we were pleased with the help we received regarding questions we had about the menu and drink selection. After we were served our main course
column4: however
column5: it was as if our waiter completely forgot about us and it was impossible to get his attention!  Our booking was 18:00-20:30
column6: and although we were served our main course around 19:00
column7: we didn't get the cheese plate until 19:40. Our server placed the cheese plate on our table and rushed away
column8: promising to return to explain what cheeses were on the plate. I am pregnant
column9: so we were concerned about whether the cheeses were pasteurized. After 10 minutes
column10: our server had not returned and was busy serving drinks to other guests
column11: seemingly oblivious to our multiple verbal and physical attempts to get his attention. We ended up hailing a server from a different part of the restaurant and he was able to help us.  At this point
column12: it was 20:10 and we were still waiting on dessert. We had planned to go to the theater after our dinner and it was looking like there was no way we would be able to make it in time
column13: so we hailed another waiter (ours still hadn't returned to us) and explained that we needed to leave soon and would appreciate our check along with dessert. He was courteous and returned shortly afterward with our check and a to-go bag with a couple of truffles.  He must have passed along our request to our original waiter who finally came to our table again with a card reader to take our payment. He didn't really ask anything about our dining experience and wasn't very concerned when we mentioned we needed to leave soon and would like our dessert.  The time had come where we needed to arrange for a taxi to make it to the theater in time
column14: and still no sign of dessert
column15: but we got up anyway to collect our coats and leave. As we were putting on our coats
column16: the waiter who had kindly helped us when our original waiter was ignoring us was running out with our desserts
column17: and although we thanked him for his help
column18: we couldn't stay to enjoy them.  All in all
column19: we started the dinner with a nice experience and ended it with a very poor and stressed experience. For a 2.5 hour dinner booking
column20: surely it is not customary for a patron to wait for an entire hour after the main course to receive the dessert? The only reason we could see for our waiter to ignore us but remain attentive to his other tables was the fact that we weren't ordering much alcohol (considering I'm pregnant). Surely we still deserve good service even though we aren't racking up an expensive drinks bill? Surely the waiter is expected to check in with us every 15-20 minutes to make sure we are ok
column21: or at the very least notice if we are waving our hands at him from afar? If we had sat and waited to complete our meal at our waiter's pace
column22: we would not have received our dessert and finished our meal until well last 20:30
column23: probably not until 21:00. Dining for 2.5 hours with good service can be a lively experience
column24: but being held hostage and being ignored for that long was extremely unpleasant and was not what we had looked forward to
column25: especially considering this was our last date night before we have our baby and therefore a special occasion.  I don't enjoy leaving negative reviews
column26: but we really do normally enjoy Djurg√•rdsbrunn so I hope this review is helpful. We don't know if we will return after this experience but maybe our review will make another patron's experience better.  Thank you for your time
